author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 70-year-old man and his 60-year-old wife were found murdered in Omalur here on Thursday.

Jegathamba of Pagalpatti was residing with his wife Chinnapillai.

They had two sons - Kandasamy and Subramani, and a daughter Thangamani. They were all married.

On Thursday morning, Subramani’s wife Chinnaponnu went to her mother in-law’s house and found both Jegathamba and Chinnapillai lying in a pool of blood. Both were hacked to death.

Neighbours rushed to the house and informed the Omalur police.

Inquiries revealed that 15 sovereign gold jewellery that she was wearing and Rs. 1 lakh cash kept in the house were missing.

Deputy Inspector General of Police Vidya Jayant Kulkarni inspected the spot and held inquiries.

Finger print experts and sniffer dog were pressed into service.

Villagers demanded the arrest of the accused and refused to allow the body to be taken to hospital.

The police pacified them and later the bodies were taken to Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital and post-mortem conducted. The police have registered a case and are investigating.
title: Elderly couple found murdered
